page.title: 13TRANSPORT IN COSHESTON AREA
page.content: Public transport in the country area round Pembroke is not very frequent. Only one bus a day, the school bus taking children to and from school, visits Cosheston. Nearly everyone in the area has a car, without one shop_ ping etc would be very difficult. Of the 17 children we interviewed at Cosheston school, all their parents had cars and 6 of them had 2 cars. There are regular bus services in Pembroke Dock, most routes having an hourly service. Fewer people in the town have cars. There is a lot of small boat sailing on the River Cleddau but no commercial river transport in our area apart from a pleasure boat which takes trips up the river from Pembroke Dock. There are no railway stations in our area, though the line passes through a tunnel in one corner of the block.
